headline: Trump-endorsed Senate hopeful Herschel Walker wins Georgia Republican primary, will face Democratic Sen. Warnock, NBC projects
author: Kevin Breuninger
sentences: GOP hopefuls in many cases have sought Trumps favor by embracing the falsehood that the election was stolen from him, raising the prospect that a wave of candidates who spread election conspiracies could take federal and state office next year.

Megan Varner | Getty Images News | Getty Images
Herschel Walker, the former pro football player and businessman endorsed by ex-President Donald Trump, will win Georgias Republican Senate primary race, NBC News projected Tuesday.

Heisman Trophy winner and Republican candidate for US Senate Herschel Walker speaks to supporters of former U.S. President Donald Trump during a rally at the Banks County Dragway on March 26, 2022 in Commerce, Georgia.

Democrats are fighting uphill: The presidents party tends to underperform in the midterm elections, and the lead-up to the primaries has been marked in part by high inflation and low approval ratings for Biden.

The primary races in Georgia, a swing state that narrowly voted for President Joe Biden in the 2020 election, also mark the biggest test to date of Trumps enduring influence over the Republican Party.
Many Republican primary candidates have tried to appeal to the partys base by talking up their pro-Trump credentials, even if the former president did not endorse them.
Trump has touted the fact that most of the candidates he endorsed in the 2022 election cycle have won their primaries, though many of those races were not competitive.
The primary elections will set the table for the November midterms, when Republicans hope to win majority control of the House and Senate.
The chamber is split 50-50 between Republicans and Democrats, and Democratic Vice President Kamala Harris holds the tie-breaking vote.
Fifteen months after his single term in the White House, the former president has held his status as the de facto leader of the GOP.
The outcome of the race could tip the balance of power in Washington, where Democrats hold a razor-thin majority in the Senate.
Walker will face off against incumbent Democratic Sen. Raphael Warnock in the general election in November, according to NBC.
Early polls of the hypothetical Walker-Warnock matchup show the candidates virtually tied, according to RealClearPolitics.
Warnock took office last year after winning a special election.
